facts.fact_text: Bitcoin sank to below $70,000 for the first time since October of 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: Bitcoin sank to below $70,000 for the first time since October of 2024

facts.fact_text: Bitcoin marked a 25% plunge since the start of the year.

evidences.evidence_text: marking a 25% plunge since the start of the year

claims.claim_text: The decline in Bitcoin was pressured by a selloff in speculative positions across a wide range of asset classes.

evidences.evidence_text: pressured by a selloff in speculative positions across a wide range of asset classes

claims.claim_text: The aggressive decline was marked by a deterioration in the narrative around cryptocurrencies, breaking against the view of a hedge against inflation and geopolitical stress, and tracking the drop in gold.

evidences.evidence_text: The aggressive decline was marked by a deterioration in the narrative around cryptocurrencies, breaking against the view of a hedge against inflation and geopolitical stress, and tracking the drop in gold.

claims.claim_text: The higher share of Bitcoin in institutional portfolios made it more vulnerable to derisking.

evidences.evidence_text: the higher share of Bitcoin in institutional portfolios made it more vulnerable to derisking

evidence.evidence_text: the higher share of Bitcoin in institutional portfolios made it more vulnerable to derisking, which recently dominated trades following higher volatility and margin requirements in precious and base metal derivatives.
breaking against the view of a hedge against inflation and geopolitical stress
